comments.comment:
the work around is to set it via URI, to avoid the (Byte) casting

<camel:to uri="smpp://user@host:1234password=78910&enquireLinkTimer=3000&transactionTimer=5000&systemType=producer&destAddrTon=0" />
org.apache.camel.component.smpp.SmppBinding.java
//  public SubmitSm createSubmitSm(Exchange exchange) throws UnsupportedEncodingException

if (in.getHeaders().containsKey(DEST_ADDR_TON)) {
 submitSm.setDestAddrTon((Byte) in.getHeader(DEST_ADDR_TON));
 } else {
 submitSm.setDestAddrTon(configuration.getDestAddrTon());
}

Use the Camel type converter so it should be something like this:

submitSm.setDestAddrTon(in.getHeader(DEST_ADDR_TON, byte.class));
Christian can you take a look at this? There may be other options set having similar issue?
I have fixed this. As well I spotted an issue in the disconnect logic, not setting the session instance to null.
